translated: Blessed One, when you have fully awakened to perfect buddhahood,

original: gang dag ma mchis pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag ma mchis pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
translated: those who will become thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas in the future will also be fully awakened.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'das pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'das pa'am /
translated: Because the inconceivable is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: not future,

original: da ltar zhes bgyi ba ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: da ltar zhes bgyi ba ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: and not present.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: su dag 'di snyam du /
analyzed: su dag 'di snyam du /
translated: those who think

original: de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa skyes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa skyes so //
translated: that the Thus-Gone One has arisen from suchness

original: zhes bgyi ba nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sems pa de dag gi 'jig rten gnas pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sems pa de dag gi 'jig rten gnas pa ni /
translated: and so on, up to: ‘He has entered into complete nirvāṇa.’

original: 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The world is deluded about this.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: they

original: 'jig rten gnas pa 'phros par bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas pa 'phros par bgyid pa lags so //
translated: are spreading the delusion of the world.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: 'jam dpal / de'i phyir khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa /🔽bsam du med pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de'i phyir khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa / bsam du med pa /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, therefore, you should explain the inconceivable,🔽inexpressible,

original: bsam gyis mi lang ba /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi lang ba /
translated: unthinkable,

original: bsam pa las 'das pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: bsam pa las 'das pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: and indescribable tathāgatas,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'am /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'am /
translated: the irreversible bodhisattva great beings,

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i mngon du brjod na rjod cig /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'i mngon du brjod na rjod cig /
translated: and the arhats who have exhausted defilements.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / de dag ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / de dag ni /
translated: Because

original: thos nas bsngags par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thos nas bsngags par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: they will not praise it when they hear it,

original: spong bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and they will not abandon it.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / @141a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / @141a *//
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: Because this is inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa /
translated: incalculable,

original: bsam gyis mi lang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi lang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and beyond thought.

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab cing bsam du ma mchis pa 'di la su zhig bsngags pa'am spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab cing bsam du ma mchis pa 'di la su zhig bsngags pa'am spong bar 'gyur /
translated: who would praise or disparage all phenomena that are inconceivable and beyond thought?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi lang bde ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba yin nam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi lang bde ltar so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba yin nam /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, just as the thus-gone ones are inconceivable, are ordinary beings also inconceivable?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin du bsam gyis mi lang ba lags so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin du bsam gyis mi lang ba lags so //
translated: ordinary beings are also inconceivable in the same way.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, that is so!

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar / bsam pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar / bsam pa thams cad ni /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because all thoughts

original: bsam gyis mi lang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi lang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: are beyond thought.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'o na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi lang ba de bzhin du so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi lang ba de bzhin du so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba'o //
translated: if the Thus-Gone One is inconceivable, then ordinary beings are also inconceivable.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i slad du de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i slad du de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One, why did you say,

original: so so'i skye bo nyid kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba ma lags sam /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba ma lags sam /
translated: ‘Ordinary beings are inconceivable’?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad bsam gyis mi lang ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das gang la la dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i slad du zhugs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad bsam gyis mi lang ba'i slad du bcom ldan 'das gang la la dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i slad du zhugs na /
translated: Blessed One, it is because all phenomena are inconceivable. Blessed One, if someone were to enter into nirvāṇa,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de dag ni /
translated: Blessed One,🔽they would be miserable.

original: nyam thag par 'gyur @141b ro; ;de ci'i slad zhe na /
analyzed: nyam thag par 'gyur @141b ro; ;de ci'i slad zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang bsam gyis mi lang pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa lags pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: gang bsam gyis mi lang pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa lags pa'i slad du ste /
translated: Blessed One, that which is inconceivable is nirvāṇa.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de'i slad du bsam gyis mi lang ba la tha dad pa ma mchis so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de'i slad du bsam gyis mi lang ba la tha dad pa ma mchis so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gang dag 'di skad du /🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad du / 'di dag ni /
translated: those who say,

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams so //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams so // 'di dag ni /
translated: ‘These are the qualities of ordinary beings,

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: and these are the qualities of the noble ones,’🔽should first serve and attend to their spiritual friends,

original: zhes mchis pa de dag la re zhig dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsnyen bkur gyis shig dang / de nas bzod pa 'di dag ni /
analyzed: zhes mchis pa de dag la re zhig dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsnyen bkur gyis shig dang / de nas bzod pa 'di dag ni /
translated: and then they will understand that these qualities

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams so //🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams so // 'di dag ni /
translated: are the qualities of ordinary beings,

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams so //🔽zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams so // zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and these are the qualities of the noble ones.

original: zhes de dag la 'di skad brjod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: zhes de dag la 'di skad brjod par bgyi'o //
translated: They should be told this.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī­kumāra­bhūta,

original: 'jam dpal / khyod de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'dod dam /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, do you consider the Thus-Gone One to be the highest of all beings?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te 'di la sems can du yongs su grub pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di la sems can du yongs su grub pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni /
translated: If there were any sentient being who was fully established in this,

original: bdag de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bdag de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'tshal lo //
translated: I would know the Tathāgata to be the highest of all sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / khyod de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang ldan par 'dod dam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang ldan par 'dod dam /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, do you want the Tathāgata to have the quality of being inconceivable?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te bsam pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni /🔽bdag de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab @142a *//
analyzed: gal te bsam pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni / bdag de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab @142a *//
translated: if there were any quality that was conceivable,

original: pa'i chos dang ldan par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: pa'i chos dang ldan par 'tshal lo //
translated: I would know the Tathāgata to have the quality of being inconceivable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di ltar /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, do you think

original: nyan thos 'di dag ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas btul to //
analyzed: nyan thos 'di dag ni / de bzhin gshegs pas btul to //
translated: that these hearers

original: zhes bya bar 'dod dam /
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'dod dam /
translated: have been tamed by the Tathāgata?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te la la zhig bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings 'dul bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te la la zhig bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings 'dul bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: if there were anyone who could tame the inconceivable realm,

original: bdag nyan thos 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pas btul to //
analyzed: bdag nyan thos 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pas btul to //
translated: “These śrāvakas were converted by the Tathāgata.”🔽

original: zhes bgyi bar de ltar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: zhes bgyi bar de ltar 'tshal lo //
translated: I think that the Tathāgata has subdued these śrāvakas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni /🔽gang la phan pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni / gang la phan pa'am /
translated: the appearance of a buddha

original: gnod par yang nye bar gnas pa ma lags so //
analyzed: gnod par yang nye bar gnas pa ma lags so //
translated: does not benefit or harm anyone.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / dbyings 'di ni /🔽gnas pa nyid dang / dbyings 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / dbyings 'di ni / gnas pa nyid dang / dbyings 'di ni /
translated: Because this realm🔽is the same,

original: ma 'dres pa nyid de /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa nyid de /
translated: and this realm is unadulterated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa'i slad du'o //
translated: because it is the inconceivable realm.

original: dbyings de la ni /
analyzed: dbyings de la ni /
translated: In that realm,

original: nyan thos tha dad pa nas so so'i skye bo tha dad pa'i bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: nyan thos tha dad pa nas so so'i skye bo tha dad pa'i bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: from the different śrāvakas up to the different ordinary beings are not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'jam dpal / khyod 'di ltar /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'jam dpal / khyod 'di ltar /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa yin par mi 'dod dam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa yin par mi 'dod dam /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, do you not assert that the Tathāgata is the unsurpassed field of merit?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams kyi zhing ste /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams kyi zhing ste /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is a field of merit because he is not a thing.

original: de'i slad du de ni /
analyzed: de'i slad du de ni /
translated: Therefore, he is

original: bsod nams kyi zhing bla na ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi zhing bla na ma mchis pa'o //
translated: the unsurpassed field of merit.

original: de ni / zhing gang ba ma lags /🔽zhing ma gang ba yang ma lags shing /
analyzed: de ni / zhing gang ba ma lags / zhing ma gang ba yang ma lags shing /
translated: He is not a filled field,🔽nor is he an unfilled field,

original: zhing ma lags pa yang @142b ma lags te /
analyzed: zhing ma lags pa yang @142b ma lags te /
translated: nor is he not a field.

original: de'i slad du de ni /
analyzed: de'i slad du de ni /
translated: Therefore, he is

original: bsod nams kyi zhing bla na ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi zhing bla na ma mchis pa'o //
translated: the unsurpassed field of merit.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽yang de la chos gang yang yang dag par 'grub par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / yang de la chos gang yang yang dag par 'grub par mi 'gyur /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bsam par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam par mi 'gyur te /
translated: no phenomenon whatsoever is accomplished or conceived in him.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de bsod nams kyi zhing lags so //
analyzed: de bsod nams kyi zhing lags so //
translated: he is a field of merit.

original: de la sa bon btab pa ni /
analyzed: de la sa bon btab pa ni /
translated: Seeds planted in him

original: rnam par mi 'phel zhing yongs su mi 'grib bo //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'phel zhing yongs su mi 'grib bo //
translated: neither increase nor decrease.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽'jam dpal / khyod kyis ci las bsam ste zhing de la sa bon btab pa rnam par mi 'phel zhing yongs su mi 'grib bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / 'jam dpal / khyod kyis ci las bsam ste zhing de la sa bon btab pa rnam par mi 'phel zhing yongs su mi 'grib bo //
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: zhes de skad smra /
analyzed: zhes de skad smra /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, what do you think when you say that seeds planted in that field neither increase nor decrease?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar / zhing de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / zhing de ni /
translated: in this way, that field

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: is inconceivable.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: de bsod nams kyi zhing lags so //
analyzed: de bsod nams kyi zhing lags so //
translated: it is a field of merit.

original: de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus sa chen po rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus sa chen po rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to //
translated: Then, at that time, through the power of the Buddha, the great earth shook in six ways.

original: dge slong khri drug stong ni /
analyzed: dge slong khri drug stong ni /
translated: Sixteen thousand monks

original: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: were liberated from defilements without further appropriation.

original: dge slong ma bdun brgya dang / dge bsnyen ma sum brgya dang / dge bsnyen ma bzhi khri dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha bye ba khrag khrig drug cu ni /
analyzed: dge slong ma bdun brgya dang / dge bsnyen ma sum brgya dang / dge bsnyen ma bzhi khri dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha bye ba khrag khrig drug cu ni /
translated: Seven hundred nuns, three hundred male lay followers, forty thousand female lay followers, and six hundred and sixty billion gods of the desire realm

original: chos kyi mig rdul dang bral zhing dri ma med pa skyes so //
analyzed: chos kyi mig rdul dang bral zhing dri ma med pa skyes so //
translated: gave rise to the dustless and stainless Dharma eye.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te chos gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di🔽skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te chos gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'jig rten du dogs cher g-yos pa byung ba 'di'i rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: 'jig rten du dogs cher g-yos pa byung ba 'di'i rgyu gang lags /
translated: what is the cause of this great earthquake that has occurred in the world?

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: What is the condition?”

original: @143a *// de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: @143a *// de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had thus requested, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: bsod nams kyi zhing bstan pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang sa phyogs 'di nyid du gsungs te /

analyzed: go skabs ma mchis pa /

analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings so // kun tu 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de /

analyzed: bdag gi dbyings gang lags pa de /

analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di bdag gi dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings so //

analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings so // gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni /

analyzed: gang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ni /

analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni / gnyis su ma mchis te /

analyzed: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni /

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na @146b bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: gang don dam par ma mchis pa de /

analyzed: ma thob pa'o //

analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

analyzed: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus bgyis pa ma lags pa'i slad du'o //

analyzed: ye shes de ni /

analyzed: sngon skyes pa'ang ma lags /

original: ye shes de ni /
analyzed: ye shes de ni /
translated: This wisdom

analyzed: sngon ma skyes pa'ang ma lags te /

analyzed: sngon ma skyes pa'i slad du gang ma skyes pa de ni / nub par yang mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: chad par yang mi 'gyur /

analyzed: ye shes de dang bral ba'i ye shes gang yang ma mchis te /

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni /
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni /

analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab cing 'dra ba ma mchis pa'o //

original: ye shes de ni /
analyzed: ye shes de ni /
translated: This wisdom

analyzed: thog ma dang / dbus dang / tha ma mi dmigs pa ste /

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni /
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni /

analyzed: mi mnyam pa mi dmigs te /

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni /
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni /

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: is the same as what is not the same.

original: ye shes de la ni /
analyzed: ye shes de la ni /
translated: In that wisdom,

original: de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i ye shes gzhan mi dmigs te /
translated: no other wisdom is observed that is similar to it.

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni /
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni /
translated: Therefore, that wisdom

original: mtshungs pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma mchis pa'o //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: 'jam dpal / ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba yin nam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba yin nam /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, is this wisdom unchangeable?”

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'di ni / ma bgyis pa ste /🔽de'i slad du 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ni / ma bgyis pa ste / de'i slad du 'di ni /
translated: it is unmade.

original: mi bsgyur ba lags so //
analyzed: mi bsgyur ba lags so //
translated: Therefore, it is unchangeable.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / karsha pa @147b na rtags ma btab pa ni /🔽bsgyur ba yang ma lags /
analyzed: dper na / karsha pa @147b na rtags ma btab pa ni / bsgyur ba yang ma lags /

analyzed: mi bsgyur ba ma lags pa'i grangs su mchi'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du ye shes 'di yang ma bgyis pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes 'di yang ma bgyis pa /
translated: in the same way, this wisdom is unmade.

original: ma bsgrubs pa /🔽ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: ma bsgrubs pa / ma bskyed pa /
translated: not accomplished,🔽not generated,

original: ma phyung ba /
analyzed: ma phyung ba /
translated: not produced,

original: ma 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'gag pa ste /
translated: and not ceased.

original: de'i slad du mi bsgyur ba legs so //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi bsgyur ba legs so //
translated: Therefore, it is excellent that it is not transformed.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa 'di la 'di ltar bstan par su dag mos /

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang dag 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma lags la /
analyzed: gang dag 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma lags la /
translated: those who are not characterized by the phenomena of saṃsāra,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yang ma lags pa dang / gang dag 'jig tshogs las kyang ma bskyod pa dang / gang dag 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug kyang ma bas pa de dag mos so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yang ma lags pa dang / gang dag 'jig tshogs las kyang ma bskyod pa dang / gang dag 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug kyang ma bas pa de dag mos so //
translated: and those who are not characterized by the phenomena of complete nirvāṇa, and those who are not shaken from the view of the transitory collection, and those who are not free from desire, anger, and ignorance—they will believe it.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi bas pa ni /🔽bas par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi bas pa ni / bas par mi 'gyur /
translated: Because the unfree🔽will not become free,

original: yongs su bas par yang mi mchi'o //
analyzed: yongs su bas par yang mi mchi'o //
translated: and will not be completely free.

original: gang dag 'khor ba las kyang ma 'das la 'khor ba'i grangs su yang mi mchi ba dang / gang dag lam dang bral ba yang ma lags shing /
analyzed: gang dag 'khor ba las kyang ma 'das la 'khor ba'i grangs su yang mi mchi ba dang / gang dag lam dang bral ba yang ma lags shing /
translated: Those who do not transcend saṃsāra, but are not counted among those in saṃsāra, and those who are not free from the path,

original: lam gyi 'du shes kyang mi skyed pa de dag gis bstan pa 'di'i don 'chal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam gyi 'du shes kyang mi skyed pa de dag gis bstan pa 'di'i don 'chal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but do not generate the notion of a path, will be corrupted by the meaning of this teaching.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī­kumāra­bhūta,

original: 'jam dpal / legs so /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / legs so /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, excellent!

original: legs so // khyod kyi tshig 'di legs par smra ba'o //
analyzed: legs so // khyod kyi tshig 'di legs par smra ba'o //
translated: Excellent! Your words are well spoken!

original: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la tshe dan ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das la tshe dan ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then at that time the venerable Mahā­kāśyapa said this to the Blessed One:

original: @148a *// bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @148a *// bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ma mchis pa'i dus na gang la la chos 'dul ba zab mo 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / kun 'tshal ba dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'byung ba mchis lags sam /
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i dus na gang la la chos 'dul ba zab mo 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / kun 'tshal ba dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba 'byung ba mchis lags sam /
translated: In the future, will there be any who will listen to this profound Dharma-Vinaya, this profound perfection of wisdom, and will believe in it, understand it, and take it up?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽'od srung / 'khor 'di nyid na'ang gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na chos 'dul ba zab mo 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / kun shes pa dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i dge slong dang /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // 'od srung / 'khor 'di nyid na'ang gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na chos 'dul ba zab mo 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / kun shes pa dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba'i dge slong dang /
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Mahākāśyapa:

original: dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag yod do //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag yod do //
translated: Kāśyapa, in this very assembly there are monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who, in the future, will listen to this profound Dharma-Vinaya, this profound perfection of wisdom, and will believe in it, understand it, and take it up.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: dper na / khyim bdag gam /
translated: For example, Kāśyapa, it is like a householder or a householder's son who has a treasure of gold or silver underground in his house.

original: khyim bdag gi bu zhig gi nor bu rin po che brgya stong ri ba stor na /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu zhig gi nor bu rin po che brgya stong ri ba stor na /
translated: If a householder’s son were to lose a precious gem worth a hundred thousand,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he would be miserable and unhappy.

original: de nyid rnyed na /
analyzed: de nyid rnyed na /
translated: If he were to find it again,

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba skye zhing kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba skye zhing kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: he would be happy and joyful, and would not have any thoughts of being bound up.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar du ma thos pa na 'di snyam du /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar du ma thos pa na 'di snyam du /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, if those monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen do not hear this profound perfection of wisdom, from ‘unproduced’ and ‘non-arisen’ up to ‘naturally in a state of nirvāṇa’ and ‘non-entity,’ they will think

original: bdag cag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya @148b ngan las 'das pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di lta bu 'di ma thos so //🔽snyam du sems so //
analyzed: bdag cag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya @148b ngan las 'das pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di lta bu 'di ma thos so // snyam du sems so //
translated: unoriginated, and essentially in a state of nirvāṇa, up to the point of being nonexistent.

original: de dag gis dus gzhan na thos par gyur pa na dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / yid dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag gis dus gzhan na thos par gyur pa na dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / yid dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: When they hear it at another time, they will be happy, joyful, and delighted.

original: kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: They will not have the mental activity of being bound up with it.

original: tshig 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshig 'di skad du /
translated: They will say these words:

original: 'di ltar / bdag cag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / ma byung ba 'di thos pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag cag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / ma byung ba 'di thos pas /
translated: ‘In this way, we have heard this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, nonexistent, unoriginated, and essentially in a state of nirvāṇa, up to the point of being nonexistent.

original: deng bdag cag gis sangs rgyas mthong zhing de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur yang byas so //🔽zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: deng bdag cag gis sangs rgyas mthong zhing de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur yang byas so // zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Today we have seen the Buddha and have also served the Tathāgata.’

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams ni /
analyzed: dper na / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams ni /
translated: For example, gods of the Thirty-Three

original: shing yongs 'du sa rtol kha 'bus pa mthong nas kye ma /
analyzed: shing yongs 'du sa rtol kha 'bus pa mthong nas kye ma /
translated: see the coral tree in bloom, and think,

original: yongs 'du sa rtol 'di ring po mi thogs par me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs 'du sa rtol 'di ring po mi thogs par me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Oh! Before long, all the flowers of this coral tree will be in full bloom.”

original: snyam ste yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //🔽'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes /
analyzed: snyam ste yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro // 'od srung / de bzhin du dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes /
translated: They are delighted and overjoyed.🔽Kāśyapa, in the same way, those monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen will be delighted and overjoyed when they hear this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn,

original: ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: non-arisen, and so on up to non-existent.”🔽“

original: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang nga'i 'khor 'di nyid na gnas par 'od srung khyod kyis shes par gyis shig /🔽gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yid dga' ba dang / rab tu @149a *//
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang nga'i 'khor 'di nyid na gnas par 'od srung khyod kyis shes par gyis shig / gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yid dga' ba dang / rab tu @149a *//
translated: Kāśyapa, you should know that those who in the future will hear this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, unarisen, and so forth up to non-existent, and will be delighted and overjoyed, they too will be in this very retinue.

original: dga' bar 'gyur ba de dag yid dga' ba de dang / rab tu dga' ba des ring po mi thogs bar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi me tog rgyas bar 'gyur bar shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: dga' bar 'gyur ba de dag yid dga' ba de dang / rab tu dga' ba des ring po mi thogs bar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi me tog rgyas bar 'gyur bar shes par gyis shig /
translated: Kāśyapa, you should know that those who in the future will be delighted and overjoyed, by that delight and joy they will soon blossom with the flowers of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'od srung / 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di ltar /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i phyir na gnas par 'gyur ba dang; spyod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang 'od srung /🔽sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i phyir na gnas par 'gyur ba dang; spyod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang 'od srung / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs sam /
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, non-arisen, and so forth up to the non-existence of entities, will in the future be present and practiced because the Tathāgata will have passed into nirvāṇa.🔽Kāśyapa, you should know that this is the Buddha’s blessing

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: and the Buddha’s power.

original: 'od srung / de bas na /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bas na /
translated: Kāśyapa, therefore

original: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas dga' na /🔽'od srung / de ni /
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas dga' na / 'od srung / de ni /
translated: those who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, non-arisen, and so forth up to the non-existence of entities, rejoice

original: de dag gi thos pa'i dang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi thos pa'i dang po ma yin no //
translated: Kāśyapa, this is not their first time hearing it.

original: 'od srung 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung 'di lta ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / nor bu mkhan zhig gis nor bu rin po che mthong nas gang gi tshe dga' bar gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: dper na / nor bu mkhan zhig gis nor bu rin po che mthong nas gang gi tshe dga' bar gyur pa de ni /
translated: for example, a jeweler sees a precious jewel. When he is delighted,

original: nor bu mkhan des nor bu rin po ched gdod mthong ba ma yin gyi /🔽de ni / sngon nas rgyun du nor bu rin po che mthong ba'o //
analyzed: nor bu mkhan des nor bu rin po ched gdod mthong ba ma yin gyi / de ni / sngon nas rgyun du nor bu rin po che mthong ba'o //
translated: “Kāśyapa, it should be understood that this is not the first time that this jeweler has seen a precious gem.

original: zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: He has seen it before, and he has seen it continuously.🔽“Kāśyapa, in the same way, when those who have heard this profound perfection of wisdom, from its not being produced to its not being a thing, are delighted,

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar gyur cing /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas yid dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar gyur cing /
translated: very much delighted,

original: mgu ba dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes na /🔽'od srung / 'di ni /
analyzed: mgu ba dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes na / 'od srung / 'di ni /
translated: and have joy, satisfaction, and mental pleasure,

original: de dag gi thos pa'i dang po ma yin no //🔽'od srung / de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag gi thos pa'i dang po ma yin no // 'od srung / de dag ni /
translated: Kāśyapa, this is not their first time hearing it.

original: 'di skad du smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Kāśyapa, they will say,

original: gang @149b 'di 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas ma skyes pa nas dngos po med pa dang / ma byung ba'i bar du bstan pa 'di nyid smros shig ces zer bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang @149b 'di 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas ma skyes pa nas dngos po med pa dang / ma byung ba'i bar du bstan pa 'di nyid smros shig ces zer bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‘Speak about this very teaching of the nonproduction of Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, up to its being a thing, its not being produced, and its not coming into existence.’

original: de dag ni sngon rgyun du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sngon rgyun du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa'o //
translated: They have all previously served Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Kāśyapa, it is like this:

original: dper na / mi la le zhig grong ngam /
analyzed: dper na / mi la le zhig grong ngam /
translated: Suppose a man goes to a village,🔽a town,

original: grong khyer ram /🔽grong rdal lam /
analyzed: grong khyer ram / grong rdal lam /
translated: a city,

original: grong gang yang rung ba zhig tu dgos pa la la zhig gi phyir song bar gyur la /
analyzed: grong gang yang rung ba zhig tu dgos pa la la zhig gi phyir song bar gyur la /
translated: or a market for some purpose.

original: yang dus gzhan zhig na de'i drung du mi la la zhig song ste /
analyzed: yang dus gzhan zhig na de'i drung du mi la la zhig song ste /
translated: Then, at another time, someone comes to him

original: grong khyer 'di'i bsngags pa brjod cing kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' ba dang / yul nyams dga' ba dang / rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dang / skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba dang / chu mig dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho phran nyams dga' ba dang /
analyzed: grong khyer 'di'i bsngags pa brjod cing kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' ba dang / yul nyams dga' ba dang / rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dang / skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba dang / chu mig dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho phran nyams dga' ba dang /
translated: and praises that town, saying, ‘The pleasure grove is delightful, the country is delightful, the ponds are delightful, the parks are delightful, the springs, lakes, and ponds are delightful,

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu nyams dga' ba de dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa nas des de thos pa dang / dga' bar tshor te yid bde ba skyes nas yang dang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu nyams dga' ba de dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa nas des de thos pa dang / dga' bar tshor te yid bde ba skyes nas yang dang yang 'di skad du /
translated: and the praises of the delightful flowers and fruits. When he hears this, he will be delighted, and with a happy mind he will ask again and again,

original: kye skyes bu /
analyzed: kye skyes bu /
translated: ‘Hey, man!

original: de nyid zlos te rjod cig /🔽ces tshol na /
analyzed: de nyid zlos te rjod cig / ces tshol na /
translated: Please tell me more about this place!’

original: mi des ni /
analyzed: mi des ni /
translated: “The man will then say,

original: sngon yang grong khyer de dang / kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' ba dang / yul nyams dga' ba dang / rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dang / skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba dang / chu mig dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho phran nyams dga' ba dang /
analyzed: sngon yang grong khyer de dang / kun dga'i ra ba nyams dga' ba dang / yul nyams dga' ba dang / rdzing bu nyams dga' ba dang / skyed mos tshal nyams dga' ba dang / chu mig dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho phran nyams dga' ba dang /
translated: ‘I have also experienced that city, those delightful parks, those delightful countries, those delightful ponds, those delightful gardens, those delightful springs, lakes, and ponds,

original: me tog dang / 'bras bu nyams dga' ba dag kyang myong ba yin par mi des de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog dang / 'bras bu nyams dga' ba dag kyang myong ba yin par mi des de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and those delightful flowers and fruits.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / de thos nas yid cher dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar @150a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar / de thos nas yid cher dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bar @150a *//
translated: Because when he hears this, he will be very happy and delighted,🔽and he will think,

original: 'gyur te / mgu ba dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur te / mgu ba dang / rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are pleased, delighted, and joyful.

original: 'od srung / de bzhin du gang dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa dang / yang dang yang drung du 'gro zhing 'dri ba byas par gyur pa dang / de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin du gang dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas par gyur pa dang / yang dang yang drung du 'gro zhing 'dri ba byas par gyur pa dang / de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang /
translated: Kāśyapa, in the same way, those who have served Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, who have gone to him again and again and asked questions, when they hear this profound perfection of wisdom, which is non-arisen,

original: ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar 'gyur te /
translated: non-ceased, and so forth up to non-existent, they will be very pleased and delighted.

original: dga' ba dang / mgu ba cher bskyed cing tshig 'di skad du /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / mgu ba cher bskyed cing tshig 'di skad du /
translated: They will greatly increase their joy and delight and say these words:

original: ma la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma la 'di lta ste /
translated: Mother, it is like this.

original: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu 'di nyid mnyan to //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu 'di nyid mnyan to //
translated: We have heard this very perfection of wisdom, which is taught as non-arisen, non-ceased, and so forth up to non-existent.

original: zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: So they say.🔽

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said this, the venerable Mahākāśyapa said to him:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ma mchis pa'i dus na dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ma mchis pa'i dus na dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu mo 'byung ba de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag bka' stsal pa de dag nyid lags sam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo 'byung ba de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag bka' stsal pa de dag nyid lags sam /
translated: in the future, will those faithful sons and daughters of good family who appear have the same characteristics, signs, and indications that the Blessed One has declared?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: 'od srung / ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te /🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'od srung / ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Kāśyapa, it is just as you have said.

original: rigs kyi bu mo 'byung ba de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo 'byung ba de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma ni /
translated: In the future, those faithful sons and daughters of good family who appear will have the same characteristics, signs, and indications

original: gang dag ngas da ltar bstan pa 'di dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang dag ngas da ltar bstan pa 'di dag nyid yin no //
translated: as those I have taught now.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal @150b gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal @150b gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos de ni /
analyzed: chos de ni /
translated: that Dharma

original: rnam pa ma mchis shing /
analyzed: rnam pa ma mchis shing /
translated: has no aspects,

original: rtags ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rang kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yang rnam pa ma mchis pa nas mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /🔽rnam pa'am / rtags sam /
analyzed: rtags ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rang kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yang rnam pa ma mchis pa nas mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na / rnam pa'am / rtags sam /
translated: The perfection of wisdom taught by the Blessed One is without aspects, up to without signs.🔽What kind of aspect, sign,

original: mtshan ma ji lta bu zhig mchis par 'gyur /
analyzed: mtshan ma ji lta bu zhig mchis par 'gyur /
translated: or mark will there be?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang lags pa de yang rnam pa ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang lags pa de yang rnam pa ma mchis /
translated: The Dharma teaching of the Blessed One is also without aspects,

original: rtags ma mchis /
analyzed: rtags ma mchis /
translated: without signs,

original: mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /
analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis pa'i bar du lags na /
translated: up to without marks.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam pa ma mchis pa dang / rtags ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa ji ltar bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa ma mchis pa dang / rtags ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma ma mchis pa ji ltar bstan par 'gyur /
translated: how can that which is without aspects, without signs, and without marks be taught?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:🔽“Mañjuśrī, it is like this: for example, space is without aspects, without signs, and without marks.

original: 'jam dpal / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bar 'di bstan na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bar 'di bstan na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, when this profound perfection of wisdom, which is utterly unborn and non-existent, is taught,

original: gang dag mos pa nas kun chub par byed pa'i bar du byed pa de dag nyid rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mos pa nas kun chub par byed pa'i bar du byed pa de dag nyid rigs kyi bu dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma yin no //
translated: those who aspire to it and put it into practice will be sons and daughters of noble family, and they will be the signs, indications, and marks of that.

original: 'jam dpal / gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa der sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan par blta'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa der sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan par blta'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, wherever the perfection of wisdom is taught, there the teachings of all the buddhas are seen.

original: der bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan par blta'o //
analyzed: der bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan par blta'o //
translated: There the inconceivable is seen to be taught.

original: 'jam dpal / ngas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yang dag par bsgrubs te dge ba'i rtsa ba @151a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ngas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yang dag par bsgrubs te dge ba'i rtsa ba @151a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the past, when I was practicing bodhisattva conduct, I accomplished roots of virtue and

original: gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par sgrub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am; rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di🔽nyid mnyan par bya /
analyzed: gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yang dag par sgrub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am; rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya /
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who wish to accomplish the roots of virtue that fully awaken to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment should listen to this transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: mos par bya /🔽yi ger bri bar bya /
analyzed: mos par bya / yi ger bri bar bya /
translated: they should believe in it,🔽they should copy it,

original: gzung bar bya /
analyzed: gzung bar bya /
translated: they should retain it,

original: bcang bar bya /🔽bklag par bya /
analyzed: bcang bar bya / bklag par bya /
translated: they should keep it,🔽they should read it,

original: lung nod par bya /🔽kha ton du bya /🔽tshig tu gdon par bya /
analyzed: lung nod par bya / kha ton du bya / tshig tu gdon par bya /
translated: they should receive it,🔽they should recite it,🔽they should proclaim it,

original: kun chub par bya /
analyzed: kun chub par bya /
translated: they should master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bya /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bya /
translated: they should properly pay attention to it,

original: bsgom par bya ba nas me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang; rgyal mtshan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang / mar me la sogs pas ci nus ci phod du mchod pa'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba nas me tog dang / bdug pa dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang; rgyal mtshan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang / mar me la sogs pas ci nus ci phod du mchod pa'i bar du bya'o //
translated: they should meditate on it, and they should make offerings to it, to the best of their abilities and strength, with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothing, parasols, victory banners, ribbons, and lamps.

original: rim gror bya'o //
analyzed: rim gror bya'o //
translated: They should serve it.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: “Sons of the Victorious Ones, if you wish to transcend the levels of all Hearers and Solitary Realizers, you should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on up to: you should make efforts to cultivate it.

original: 'jam dpal / ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ba de lta bu nyan par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ba de lta bu nyan par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, if you wish to listen to how to enter the irreversible level, you should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on up to: you should make efforts to cultivate it.

original: 'jam dpal / chos gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos gang yang rung ste /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, if you wish to listen to how all phenomena,

original: de dag thams cad ma skyes par mnyan pa nyid du mos par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim @151b gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ma skyes par mnyan pa nyid du mos par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim @151b gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: whatever they may be, are the same in being unborn, you should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on up to: you should make efforts to cultivate it.”

original: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, a son or daughter of good family who wishes to fully awaken to all the qualities of a Buddha should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on up to: they should make efforts to honor it.

original: 'jam dpal / chos thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata has fully awakened to all phenomena.

original: zhes shin tu bstan pa 'di la mos par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: zhes shin tu bstan pa 'di la mos par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: A son or daughter of good family who wishes to believe in this very clear teaching should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on up to: they should make efforts to honor it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'am /🔽gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'am / gang gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'am /
translated: Why is that?🔽There is no phenomenon whatsoever that causes full awakening,🔽by which one causes full awakening,

original: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i chos de gang yang med de /
analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i chos de gang yang med de /
translated: or to which one causes full awakening.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not perceived.

original: de ltar don 'di rtogs shing mos par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar don 'di rtogs shing mos par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: Thus, a son or daughter of good family who wishes to understand and believe in this meaning should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on up to: they should make endeavours about it.

original: gang byang chub ma yin pa'i chos de gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang byang chub ma yin pa'i chos de gang yang med do //
translated: There is no dharma at all that is not enlightenment.

original: zhes de ltar mos par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: zhes de ltar mos par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: Thus, a son or daughter of good family who wishes to believe in this should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on up to: they should make endeavours about it.

original: chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: A son or daughter of good family who wishes to have no conceptualization about all dharmas should listen to this perfection of wisdom, and so on up to: they should make endeavours about it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang gis yongs su grub @152a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang gis yongs su grub @152a *//
translated: And why is that?🔽Because the perfection of wisdom does not establish any dharma by which it might be completed.

original: pa rnam par gzhog pa'am /
analyzed: pa rnam par gzhog pa'am /
translated: Or,🔽

original: bskyed pa'am / ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /🔽rnam par byang ba ma yin zhes bya bar 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'am / ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin / rnam par byang ba ma yin zhes bya bar 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: because they are not produced or revealed.

original: chos thams cad 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'das pa ma yin /
translated: “If sons or daughters of good family wish to understand that all phenomena are neither afflicted nor purified, they should listen to this perfection of wisdom, memorize it, keep it, read it, and be dedicated to it.🔽“If sons or daughters of good family wish to understand that all phenomena are neither past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: nor future,

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin zhes bya bar mos par bya bar 'dod cing 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin zhes bya bar mos par bya bar 'dod cing 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: nor present, they should listen to this perfection of wisdom, memorize it, keep it, read it, and be dedicated to it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / skye ba med pa ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / skye ba med pa ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, non-arising

original: 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'das pa ma yin /
translated: is neither past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: nor future,

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nor present.🔽And why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'jam dpal /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: All phenomena

original: skye ba med pa la rton pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la rton pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are based on non-arising.

original: de lta bu'i chos thams cad la the tshom med par rtogs par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos thams cad la the tshom med par rtogs par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, a son or daughter of good lineage who wishes to understand without doubt all phenomena such as these should listen to this perfection of wisdom and so forth up to honor it.

original: 'jam dpal / lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo ji ltar gyur pa de nyan par 'dod pa dang / de rtogs par 'dod pa dang / de la mos par 'dod pa dang / de la 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid @152b mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo ji ltar gyur pa de nyan par 'dod pa dang / de rtogs par 'dod pa dang / de la mos par 'dod pa dang / de la 'jug par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid @152b mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, a son or daughter of good lineage who wishes to hear, who wishes to understand, who wishes to believe, and who wishes to enter into the wheel of the Dharma that has been turned three times and in twelve aspects should listen to this perfection of wisdom and so forth up to honor it.

original: sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par bya bar yang 'dod la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par bya bar yang 'dod la /
translated: One who wishes to pervade all sentient beings with love

original: sems can du 'du shes pa la yang mi gnas par 'dod pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad dang rtsod pa med par yang 'dod cing 'jig rten thams cad mi dmigs par rtogs par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ba nas rim gro'i bar du bya'o🔽// chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bar du rtogs par yang 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshal gyis bslab par bya'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: nus pa ci yang ma mchis pa /
analyzed: nus pa ci yang ma mchis pa /
translated: is powerless,

original: kun nas spong bar mi bgyid pa /
analyzed: kun nas spong bar mi bgyid pa /
translated: does not reject anything,

original: rnam par 'jig par mi bgyid pa /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig par mi bgyid pa /
translated: does not destroy anything,

original: ches gang yang mi len mi 'dor ba /
analyzed: ches gang yang mi len mi 'dor ba /
translated: does not take up or give up anything at all,

original: g-yo ba ma mchis pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba ma mchis pa /
translated: is unmoving,

original: byed pa ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: byed pa ma mchis pa lags /
translated: and does not act.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: ngo bo nyid shes pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid shes pa ma lags pa /
translated: is not the knowledge of the essence,

original: ngo bo nyid mthong ba ma lags pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mthong ba ma lags pa /
translated: is not the seeing of the essence,

original: chos gang yang sbyin par mi bgyid pa /
analyzed: chos gang yang sbyin par mi bgyid pa /
translated: does not give away any phenomena,

original: chos thams cad dang mi 'gal ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang mi 'gal ba /
translated: is not in conflict with any phenomena,

original: chos thams cad tha dad par mi bgyid pa lags na /
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad par mi bgyid pa lags na /
translated: and does not make any phenomena different.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽shes rab kyi pha @153a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / shes rab kyi pha @153a *//
translated: Blessed One,

original: rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gang lags /
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gang lags /
translated: what are the qualities of the perfection of wisdom?

original: phan yon gang lags /
analyzed: phan yon gang lags /
translated: What are its benefits?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad gcig tu bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad gcig tu bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: the perfection of wisdom does not make all phenomena one,

original: chos thams cad tha dad par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: does not make all phenomena different,

original: ma bgyis pa /
analyzed: ma bgyis pa /
translated: is not made,

original: bgyi ba ma mchis pa /🔽mi bas pa /
analyzed: bgyi ba ma mchis pa / mi bas pa /
translated: It is not something to be done.🔽It is not something to be destroyed.

original: rnam par 'jig par mi bgyid pa /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig par mi bgyid pa /
translated: It is not something to be annihilated.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams dang / dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams dang / dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that gives rise to the qualities of ordinary beings, the qualities of arhats, the qualities of bodhisattvas, or the qualities of buddhas.

original: 'grib par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: 'grib par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that diminishes.

original: 'khor ba len par mi bgyid pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba len par mi bgyid pa /
translated: It is not something that takes up saṃsāra.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'dor bar mi bgyid pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'dor bar mi bgyid pa /
translated: It is not something that abandons nirvāṇa.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that gives rise to the qualities of buddhas.

original: rnam par 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa /🔽bsam par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa / bsam par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that is annihilated.🔽It is not something to be imagined.

original: bsam du ma mchis pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: bsam du ma mchis pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that is not to be imagined.

original: bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something to be done.

original: 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: 'jig par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something to be destroyed.

original: chos thams cad skye ba ma lags pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that gives rise to any phenomena.

original: 'gog pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: 'gog pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that ceases.

original: chad par bgyid pa ma lags pa; rtag par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: chad par bgyid pa ma lags pa; rtag par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that is cut off. It is not something that is permanent.

original: 'ong bar bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: 'ong bar bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not something that comes.

original: 'gro bar bgyid pa ma lags pa /🔽dben par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: 'gro bar bgyid pa ma lags pa / dben par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not a goer.🔽It is not a separator.

original: mi dben par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: mi dben par bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not a non-separator.

original: gnyis su bgyid pa ma lags pa /
analyzed: gnyis su bgyid pa ma lags pa /
translated: It is not a doubler.🔽It is not a non-doubler.

original: mi gnyis par bgyid pa ma lags pa'i yon tan gang lags /
analyzed: mi gnyis par bgyid pa ma lags pa'i yon tan gang lags /
translated: What are its qualities?

original: phan yon gang lags /
analyzed: phan yon gang lags /
translated: What are its benefits?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur @153b gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur @153b gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: 'jam dpal / dngos po med pa nas byed pa med pa'i bar 'di nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i yon tan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dngos po med pa nas byed pa med pa'i bar 'di nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i yon tan du rig par bya'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, from the absence of entities up to the absence of activity, you should know these to be the qualities of this perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jam dpal / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la slob par 'dod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la sgrub par 'dod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad snang ba dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la slob par 'dod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la sgrub par 'dod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad snang ba dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, moreover, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to train in the bodhisattva samādhi, who wish to accomplish the bodhisattva samādhi, and who wish to abide in that samādhi through which they will see all the blessed buddhas🔽and their buddha realms,

original: de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyang mthong bar 'dod pa dang / de dag gi ming yang shes par 'dod pa dang / de dag la mchod pa bla na med pa yang byed par 'dod pa dang / de dag gi chos bstan pa la yang 'jug par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams kyang mthong bar 'dod pa dang / de dag gi ming yang shes par 'dod pa dang / de dag la mchod pa bla na med pa yang byed par 'dod pa dang / de dag gi chos bstan pa la yang 'jug par 'dod pa dang /
translated: who wish to know their names, who wish to make unsurpassable offerings to them, who wish to engage with their teachings of the Dharma,

original: mos par 'dod pas mi bslab pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mos par 'dod pas mi bslab pa'i tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and who wish to aspire to them should train in this perfection of wisdom itself, without training in any other way.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ci'i slad du 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is it called the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / ma skyes ma 'gag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / ma skyes ma 'gag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, it is called the perfection of wisdom because it is unborn and unceasing.

original: 'di ltar yang gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / bya ba med pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar gyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / bya ba med pa nas dngos po med pa'i bar gyi phyir te /
translated: It is also because it is primordially peaceful, non-arising, and free from activity, up to the absence of entities.

original: gang dngos po med pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: That which is absent of entities is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jam dpal de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par shes par bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, for that reason, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom by bodhisattva great beings should be understood.

original: gang chos thams cad spyod yul ma yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi spyod yul te /🔽'di la spyod na byang chub sems dpa' @154a *//
analyzed: gang chos thams cad spyod yul ma yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi spyod yul te / 'di la spyod na byang chub sems dpa' @154a *//
